sub_title: System Engineer in the ESA Concurrent Design Facility
summary:
Space engineer experienced in system engineering and programmatic/strategic management. Worked on several cross-continental projects, including for robotic space exploration and space navigation.

Currently a System Engineer for the European Space Agency (ESA) in the Concurrent Design Facility.

PAST ACHIEVEMENTS:

- Prev. advisor to ESA PB-NAV and European Commission GNSS Committee
- Prev. co-ordinator of German strategy for EGNSS evolutions (Galileo 2nd Generation)
- Prev. deputy Project Manager and System Engineer for MASCOT mission
- DLR Talent Management Programme 2014-2015
- Elected to the Board of the DLR Scientific-Technical Council in 2014
- Guest speaker / panellist at Keio University, Japan (2013), Space Generation Fusion Forum (2013), and INCOSE Switzerland (2012)
- Awarded:	Paul Shoda Prize in Aerospace Engineering (2008, University of Glasgow), 	Faculty of Engineering Dean’s List (2008, University of Glasgow), Aeronautical Engineering Fourth Year Class Prize (2007, University of Glasgow)
- Co-founder of SpaceUp Bremen „unconference“ (2014)
